poem:
Title: "In the Gilded Halls of Governance"

In the hush of morn, a President speaks,
Demarcating dreams with words like stepping stones;
Staunchly aid bound for Gaza he seeks,
And Trump's shadow he brusquely owns.

In the echoing Congress, Santos arose,
A silent pledge bound by the heart's decree,
In the folds of November, destiny's prose,
What was, what is, and what will be.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Joe Biden delivers feisty State of the Union address with vision for his second term Joe Biden confirmed a new US mission to deliver aid to Gaza and repeatedly took aim at Donald Trump in his State of the Union address on Thursday, offering a pointed preview of the general election in November. Related: George Santos attends State of the Union and announces another run for Congress Biden’s most significant announcement came toward the end". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Joe Biden delivers feisty State of the Union address with vision for his second term Joe Biden confirmed a new US mission to deliver aid to Gaza and repeatedly took aim at Donald Trump in his State of the Union address on Thursday, offering a pointed preview of the general election in November. Related: George Santos attends State of the Union and announces another run for Congress Biden’s most significant announcement came toward the end
